txt.en: 'Have you something for me?'
'Thank you, [placeholder]. I was in need of a fresh spear!'
'Have you anything for me?'
Impressed by your courage and willingness to assist the people of Eaworth, Goldwine has decided to offer you another task.

'I am impressed by your courage, [placeholder]. The Vale has become a dangerous place, and you braved it to bring us the materials we need to arm ourselves for the siege.

'If you are willing, I have one more task for you. Use the ore and branches you gathered to craft spears at the blacksmith's forge.

'When this is done, deliver the spears to the guards throughout the city, then return to me.'
The blacksmith's forge is in Eaworth, near the Mead Hall.\n\nGoldwine asked you to forge spears for the guards of Eaworth.
'Thank you for your services, [placeholder]. We shall be prepared for whatever course of action Reeve Ingbert decides upon.'
The guards of Eaworth can be found throughout the city.\n\nGoldwine asked you to bring the spears you crafted to the guards of Eaworth.
Goldwine stands guard near the blacksmith's forge in Eaworth.\n\nYou should let Goldwine know that you have delivered the spears to the guards of Eaworth.
'Thank you for this spear, [placeholder]. The shaft of my old one had been cracked for some time.'
'Have you something for me?'
'This, at least, is a sign that we will defend ourselves if attacked. I only hope that Lord Ingmar convinces his father to take swifter action.'
Craft spears for the guards of Eaworth
'Have you something for me?'
Deliver spears ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Delivered spears ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Be of good cheer, [placeholder]! This spear shall skewer Orcs before long!'
Talk to Goldwine
The Armourer's Assistant
'Have you something for me?'
'A fresh spear... that is well. We shall soon be overrun by Orcs.'
